caption: Very nice cozy place!!!

I feel compelled to write a review of Sal's Trattoria because it is a neighborhood staple. My husband and I order dinner from Sal's at least once every two weeks (salad, meatballs, mussels, chicken parm is the usual order). The food is always delicious, the service always solid. A great Italian restaurant!

I have been here three times since moving to Chicago. It's a quiet neighborhood spot; perfect for date nights or if you have friends and family in town as well! They serve some of my personal favorite beef carpaccio.

The Italian food here is some of the best I've ever had.  While they have traditional favorites, they also offer "modern"  or "fusion" takes on classics. They use high quality olive oil in their dishes (not vegetable oil like some other local Italian spots) and you can tell the difference.  Food always tastes fresh and never greasy or over-salted. We've done takeout a couple of times, and the quality or portions have not changed from their indoor dining days.  Their gnocchi, calamari, and their bread is always worth savoring, and the other dishes are good, too!
Amazing place for food enthusiasts and great service.
Perfect carryout the other night. Caesar salad chicken Parma arugula salad and crab cake. Can’t wait to be able to eat inside again.
Killer neighborhood spot with excellent food and friendly staff.

Priced like an elegant meal when really it's just decent Italian food with poor execution. There's no spark of passion in this place.  Free bread is cold and most likely not homemade. Being sat near a waiter station, I saw them taking the baskets from the pile of 2 dozen baskets, and restocking those 2 dozen baskets about once an hour. I think Olive Garden has a better, warmer, fresher bread experience.  We ordered the SPECIAL caprese salad with mushrooms, mozzerella, basil, and tomatoes; when it comes out it has exactly 2 CHERRY tomatoes on the whole plate, and exactly 1 WHOLE basil leaf, and mozzerella was nothing better than grocery store...clearly needed more attention to basics because I could execute this better at home.  Pasta was good flavor but poor texture/cooking, I think the rigatoni noodles were just too thick. Earlier in the meal, the waiter told us they get their pasta from a small shop in north Chicago, so they're clearly trying a little bit...but for a local upscale (read: expensive) Italian shop...how are you not making your own noodles??? By the way, this dish was the one the waiter said 'Everyone should order this at least once here in their lifetime.'  Espresso: We were sat near their espresso machine; twice I saw a waiter begin to make a fancy coffee, activating the steamer and putting it in the cup, moving it around and such...and then he would dump anything in the cup out, look over his shoulder, and discreetly open up the cupboard below and pour coffee from an urn into the cup. There's two logical explanations here and I don't know which one is worse. 1) The patrons ordered coffee and he was heating up the cup before putting pre-brewed coffee in there (which must be at least an hour old because I never saw them change it), or 2) They ordered an espresso based drink, and the waiter fakes making it, only to pour pre-brewed coffee into the cup. Either way something is wrong there.  Lastly, ambiance was a little bit off putting, right in front of my view (near the espresso machine) were ~4 credit card reading machines all charging up with wires hanging down near my date's head. Needs a tune-up.
Had a small family gathering there last night, food was fantastic along with atmosphere and service. Highly recommend!

Sal’s is the most perfect, cozy, beautiful, delicious restaurant in Chicago. Skip the big fancy River North steakhouses and instead be treated like family at Sal’s. The staff is attentive without being annoying and the food is truly amazing. They make all pasta from scratch, it can’t be beat. They go the extra mile to make your time there amazing. Thank you for giving us a little slice of Italy right here in Lincoln park Sal’s!
Good food, friendly staff, and plenty of outdoor seating (very covid safe).
AMAZING
This place is great. Nice people and the food is excellent. Love the mussels!

The prices are amazing and so reasonable considering the portion size you get with such great food at a city restaurant. The absolute best part about Sal's Trattoria though is how kind the owner and employees are. Amazing.

Avoid for groups! I made a reservation for the outdoor patio over a week in advance for a group of six. My friends were coming in from the suburbs to celebrate my birthday. The gentleman I made the reservation with was so nice and told me I was all set. I called a few minutes before the reservation time to let them know we were on our way and the woman who answered the phone informed me they did not have me on the list and they were too busy to accommodate us. She was incredibly rude and placed me on hold where she ultimately hung up on me. I feel this is unacceptable and I won’t be returning, which is sad as we were neighborhood regulars before Covid. I would think twice about making a reservation on a weekend night for a larger group.
Delicious Italian food! - @ChicagoBYOB
Beautiful restaurant, great neighborhood spot!
Very cozy pretty atmosphere
(Translated by Google) My work  (Original) Mi trabajito
I was so bummed the restaurant 1 block north closed. Then I walked into this alternative establishment. So I am all better now.

Good service,  friendly staff,  clean and great atmosphere.  The menu is not overwhelming.  I have had the spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parmigiana and both were good.  Portions are good size and salads are fresh. Also a good place for a night cap.

Food... superb.  Service... superb.  Made a late reservation request, which they squeezed in for us,  and even when I was 10 minutes late,  they held for us.  And I didn't even tell them it was our 16th anniversary.  They knew me from my request when I showed up and made us feel very welcomed.  Next time we're in the area,  we'll go back. -Paul, Beloit, WI.

Amazing meal from start to finish! First time we have been there and everything was excellent, had the Burrata, the Orecchiette, and the best Gelato I’ve ever had. Our server was on top of everything made great recommendations and offered us additional toasted bread for the Burrata. The wine was a Super Tuscan and it was delicious. I wish we lived closer so we could visit every week. Really delicious and great prompt service. Could not recommend enough. Thanks you for a great night with friends and a wonderful birthday dinner for my fiancé!
Great food, neighborhood upscale attitude
Portions to small
Great Italian restaurant.  Kid-friendly but yet elegant.  The meal was delicious.  They have a full bar.  Great place to go in the neighborhood for a nice dinner.
Great food and abience
Romantic and cozy atmosphere. Great food!

This place is amazing.  My dad and I sat at the bar and the service was excellent.  The grilled calamari appetizer was no joke one of the best dishes I have ever tasted in my life.  My dad had the Rigatoni Bolognese  and I had the FETTUCCINI CARBONARA both dishes were really good.  Best Italian food I have had in a long time.
Legit italian
Great food and service!
Amazing food with excellent service with nice atmosphere at prices that won't break the bank
If you like seared salmon, step up your flavor experience and don't hesitate to order the rainbow trout. Sensational flavors and exceptionally succulent!
Awesome rainbow trout picatta and crab cakes.
Loved sals...awesome place!!!!!
The food really good, the attention also very good.
Delectable food, good wine, and a lovely atmosphere. Service was attentive without hovering. Excellent experience
Excellent food and atmosphere!😊

Food was great, service was good (somewhat disorganized), wine selection is appropriate. Special dish to try - mussels with perfect mopping sauce.  Patio dinner served on the standard metal picnic tables was really big drawback for white tablecloth trattoria; some semblance of the tablecloth would be a big improvement.
Phenomenal; simple done-right Italian cuisine.  Bringing parents here next time they're in town and craving pasta (or anything else even remotely related to Italy: "wine?, sure! I know a place!").
So good!!! Must stop for Italian food

I'm a food courier and do business with you guys. The last time I picked up an order I slipped down the stairs because they were very slippery. There should be a handrail by the stairs. The floor was also very slippery/greasy I had to walk slowly to prevent from slipping again.
Great service...
Outstanding, food, drink, & waitstaff.  The shrimp in fra diablo fettuccine was well worth the visit.  Cannot go wrong!
Great cocktails and impeccable service, with an approachable, delicious, and modern Italian menu.
Great neighborhood spot

This place is great! While the menu is small and there probably isn't too much that you haven't had before, the reason this place sticks out is they make every dish exceedingly well. I mean, I'm honestly impressed when I go there and get something as simple and common as a chicken pesto sandwich! It's that good.
This restaurant was absolutely incredible. It was beautiful and had amazing food and service.I will be back soon.
Great food
The coke tasted very good.
Nice joint. One of our go-tos. The mussel app is fantastic! We're also fans of the rigatoni. Attentive service.
Everything we are was delicious and service was really good. Best minestrone I've ever had.

Love this spot! My husband and I always try to snag a seat at the bar. The hosts are always really accommodating and the bartenders are awesome. I try to get something new on the menu each time and I’m never disappointed. The Bolognese is incredible

Ended up at Sal's after another local place did not have any space (a shocker on a Wednesday evening). A friend of mine had enjoyed a lovely evening at Sal's a while back and I have driven by several times, curious about the place. My friend and I had tried calling (not sure if there was a bad number listed or what) and couldn't get through, but when we walked in we were welcomed by the whole staff. Our server was very attentive and even the bar tender came over to tell us all about a lovely post dinner port that we were trying. Good sized portions (but not overwhelming) and a great take on traditional Italian dishes. Great to know that we have an wonderful Italian place nearby!

I have driven past Sal's countless times.  A small corner establishment along Southport Ave.  We decided to stop in and visit Sal's one evening.  We called to reserve a table for two on a Saturday evening with three hour advance notice.  Uh ya... too late.  But, we still wanted to give it a try so we decided to just show up and see what happens. Yep... glad I did!!  We were sat immediately at the bar which was perfect for us.  Ample room and just enough seats to keep it cozy.  I wish I could remember our bartender's name because he was outstanding; between the wine and food pairing recommendations to the general conversation in between his duties, we had the best seat in the house.  The rest of the seating was well spaced out and could accommodate a couple's special occasion or the engagement party that was seated behind us. We started with the Grilled Calamari which was top notch.  She had the Fettuccine Cabornara and I had the Sea Bass which was on special.  The fettuccine was creamy deliciousness and the bass was a baked flaky forget the knife fall off the fork goodness.  As I said, the bartender paired us up both with wines that suited our meals.  One was a Montepulciano D'Abruzzo and the other was a Landmark Vinyards Pinot.  Perfect - period!!! For desert, we had a Pumpkin Gelato and my chocolate addiction kept me steering toward the Flourless Chocolate Cake with a vanilla sauce that added to my sweet tooth. As I said earlier Sal's is a small establishment set on the west side of Southport Ave just north of Diversey.  Don't sneeze and pass this place up.  You will regret it!
Great meal from appetizers to dessert. Calamari, pasta dishes are superb. Don't forget the tiramisu and lemon tart.
Charming place, excellent food.
Food meant for God's served by those who are passionate about serving mere mortals with equal devotion.

Sal’s is a great place, one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago! We went there for the first time tonight, and everything was elite. The service was far above and beyond. We had a last minute 8:30pm reservation but when we arrived our table was not ready; but they were very accommodating, honest, and friendly the entire time while we waited. After that, the service and the food was outstanding. Thank you for the great service, we will definitely be back!!!
Great neighborhood Italian. Crab cake and carpaccio were both awesome.

I love this place. It's super quaint, it's low key, its hella neighborly. Vastly underrated. Theres this one dessert there with like... Mocha or something. It's kinda like pudding. It's my favorite thing in the world. Been here dozens of times because I live nearby and have yet to have any food that is anything less than perfect. I'm actually hesitant to give it such a good review because I like being able to get a table lol
Kitchen is awful smells terrible like a dumpster i wouldnt eat from there

I went there shortly after it opened, being delighted with the prospect of a new Italian restaurant near enough to walk to. Sadly the service was very poor initially. I gave them another chance tonight and not only was there service flawless but the food was delicious! Loved it! I'll be back again soon!
This is the cutest neighborhood spot that works for so many occasions. And the food is delicious! Pasta is fantastic, and don't skip dessert.
Quite simply the best Italian in Chicago, wrapped in a quaint neighborhood spot.
Great staff awesome date night place.
The Bolognese was phenomenal!
Fresh and good, try it you'll like it.
Delicious mussels and salmon and great service last night at Sal's - our go-to restaurant!
Great food. Very professional and friendly.

The bus boy was a rude little spoiled punk.  He ruined the experience for our entire group.  We were seated at the table closest to the stairs heading down.  The bus boy told me his name was Kaitlyn (yea right!!) with a smirk just after his statement "hey, you are in a restaurant and this stuff happens" just after a drink was spilled on us.  His haircut was very short on one side and long on top and flopped to the other side.   He was also rude when we sat down and filled our water.  One of us asked if he would be taking our order and he made a wise comment and turned and walked away.  His attitude made it seem that he was the spoiled entitled son of one of the bosses or owner there and could do no wrong.  Just a bad experience.
Beautiful place and the food and service were excellent.
Had the 'off the menu' Elk - it was 'off the planet good.'  Attentive service and overall fine experience.
Nice interior, slightly older - Lincoln Park? - crowd. Traditional American style Italian fare - somewhat bland. Friendly host/manager, efficient waitstaff service.

It's a cosy local Italian restaurant. Requires reservation. A variety of delicious culinary options, excellent service, relatively quieter for an Italian type of restaurant. The Chianti from Tuscany was superb.  I'll be back again and recommend to friends. Enjoy your visit to Sal's Trattoria!
Terrific food and service in a warm atmosphere.
Had a great time at this neighborhood gem. Pasta was amazing.

Our experience was less than ideal for my birthday. We showed up about 10 minutes early, and were told we had to wait, which I was fine with, but there were 8 tables available. When I asked about them they said they were for upcoming reservations. Fine. But then we had to wait 20 minutes for our table and they seated us after our reserved time. They sat us at a table that was basically on top of the waiter's ordering computers, so we constantly had staff standing over our table talking. My entree got screwed up, and they didn't offer anything to make up for it. Eventually,  our meal was over and 5 of the 8 tables we saw available when we walked in were still empty. Probably not going to go back
Excellent food and service

Well prepared classic italian fare, from quality products. Humble and value driven wine list by the glass and moreso by the bottle. Don't miss the house cocktails, great start to a meal, maybe the best Old Fashioned you've had.
Holy cannoli! This place is delicious!
Casual elegant atmosphere, quality selections, reasonable prices.
We are so happy Sal's is near by. Sal's has wonderful food, cocktails, and service. We love to sit at the bar and meet new people as we enjoy Sal's amazing food.

This place is amazing. The restaurant seating is tight but cozy and warm. the staff was very detailed about the menu. You Have to place a reservation if you want to get seated. Prices was very affordable and food was amazing. A great place for a date night. Most definitely will visit this place again
Great local spot. Family friendly.
Amazing food and very accommodating.  Every time we have gone, even without a reservation, they were nice and worked us in.  Best neighborhood spot around.
Decent food and pricing. I would go again, but I'd like to see a little more variety and less of the standard Italian fare to set this place apart from the competition.
Great Food!

The food is always great, we have had mix up associates with orders which is most likely due to growing pains of a newer place. I will say that management is always great and has more than made up for it. Wonderful food.
Good food, good service y affordable price
Marinara sauce was too heavy for the gnocchi.  But good service and atmosphere.
Good food and service
It is over-rated! Not only did I feel this way but some other customers mentioned the same as well.

Reminds me of our trip to Umbria last year.  We've gone back here twice in 2 weeks.  This is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.  Their $29 bottle of montepulciano red is quite good, I loved the grilled calamari, broiled shrimp, riggatoni bolognese, and spinach tagliatelle.

Honestly this could have been 5 stars but the main dishes took almost an hour to arrive after the appetizers with no accountability or explanation from the waitress or manager. We were seated before 6pm when the restaurant was 1/4 full and people who were seated well after us were already gone while we sat puzzled and waited for our entrees. And we asked, and asked, and asked, and then even got up to get the manager. The food was definitely good. But this is a neighborhood spot and we had 2 young kids with us. If you are eating downtown on a Saturday dinner may take 2+ hours. But on a Thursday at 6pm?! Own up, explain, apologize, check in, and apologize again when we leave inviting us back. A free dessert when we were trying to pay and leave and had already declined dessert was not what we were looking for. I don't think I can go back unfortunately and I really would want to.

This was my first visit to Sal's, and Sarah, at the bar, was exceptionally attentive and introduced me to a lovely Montepulciano de Abruzzo, which paired delightfully with the special of Seared White Tuna over Squid Ink Pasta with a Rustic Tomato Sauce. The Chef came by to ensure the dish was to my satisfaction. My expectations were met and exceeded!! It was exceptional and the best "black" pasta I've ever had!  I will definitely be back!!!
Outstanding food and service.
Really great place.  Good food and great servers.  No complains.  Definitely worth a trip

We had a wonderful pre-show dinner. Everything was very good & the prices are quite reasonable. The wait staff, chef, & owner were all very attentive, welcoming, & friendly.  We had the grilled calamari, fettuccine carbonara, gnocchi marinara, & olive oil cake along with a bottle of Marchesi di Barolo that complimented all courses.  We are going back in two weeks & are very excited to try other menu items.
